We need an Education Secretary who cares about our student's health and wellbeing.
https://t.co/A6jpkiR4Bk

Folks – last week I voted to pass a new COVID relief bill that would send you another stimulus check and provide millions to keep our small businesses open and to safely reopen our schools. But the Senate is still refusing to vote on it. We need a deal now!

On #WorldTeacherDay I want to take a moment to recognize all the incredible teachers across the Valley, who have always done so much for our community, but during this pandemic have stepped up in a truly incredible way. THANK YOU TEACHERS! https://t.co/C7Jx1U46GQ

I truly can’t understand the logic here – you have to take this test to get into college, but more than half of testing sites are closed – what are these kids supposed to do?

TODAY – get a FREE Covid test:

➡ Stanislaus County Library, 1500 I St., Modesto, from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Monday, Sept. 28.

The wildfires this year have been devastating – and with more than three million acres burned – we need to take proactive steps to stop the fires, and protect the health of folks who have to be outside in the smoke. That’s just what my amendments will do. 
https://t.co/LtnVK7TUTC

TODAY/TOMORROW – get a FREE Covid-19 test in Ceres:

➡ Ceres High School, 2320 Central Avenue, from noon to 6 p.m. Saturday and 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Sunday.

Huge news folks – yesterday the House passed TWO of my amendments! These will help prevent wildfires and protect the health of farmworkers who have to work outside in the smoke. https://t.co/1qYD4baZ01

During this Pandemic, nursing home residents have been put through the wringer. We have to make sure that they have the opportunity to have their voices heard. 
https://t.co/kBsuoZfrha
Our small businesses have been stuck between a rock and a hard place during the COVID crisis. This #SmallBusinessWeek, I’m keeping up the fight to get our small businesses more economic relief.

MARK YOUR CALENDARS – two FREE pop-up testing sites will be open in Stanislaus: 

➡ Ceres High School, 2320 Central Avenue, from noon to 6 p.m. Saturday and 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Sunday.

➡ Stanislaus County Library, 1500 I St., Modesto, from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Monday, Sept. 28.

I want to thank @SenDougJones for joining me in the fight to protect our fairs. Working together, we'll push to get our fairs the relief they need to weather this storm – we don’t want to lose a single acre of fairgrounds because of the pandemic.

https://t.co/SSNu32acZ2

We want to get businesses back open and school in-person as soon as we can – this bill will unleash the American spirit of innovation to do just that. We’ve relied on big ideas throughout our history – this pandemic should be no different.

https://t.co/WDtDdqisKb

Folks – there’s less than two weeks to fill out the 2020 Census. The Census determines how much money our community gets for schools, to fix roads and bridges, and to fund our hospitals. Fill yours out today, I promise it only takes three minutes! https://t.co/00ebUqeEiZ
Both parties need to come to the table – we need a Covid relief bill to support our schools, businesses, and send another stimulus check. It’s beyond time to get folks help.

I’ve heard from people across the Valley who have asthma, diabetes, and other health concerns and are still facing delays in the delivery of their medicines. The Postmaster General needs to do his job. People’s lives literally depend on it.

https://t.co/ARRVtMy0dz
Our Coronavirus numbers (positivity rate, hospitalizations, even deaths) are FINALLY starting to move in the right direction. Let’s keep up our fight against the virus!

Congress literally passed not one, but TWO bills to guarantee that COVID testing would be free. This is beyond unacceptable and shows that big corporations are still just out to make a buck during a global pandemic.

Folks – please be safe as you celebrate this holiday weekend. This COVID nightmare isn’t over yet.

This is just awful. We all have a part to play to slow the spread of this virus.

I promised to set a new standard of accessibility in the Valley – and we’ve done it even during a pandemic. Last week, we hosted our FIRST EVER drive through office hours. It was great to meet with so many folks from across our community (from a safe distance)! https://t.co/Io5jYlBBsp
Folks – yesterday we saw the HIGHEST single day positivity rate for Covid in Stanislaus County. Please be safe – this virus is still spreading in our community.

This is good news. We need to get in the game and back to Washington to get something passed. Never should have left. The pandemic isn't over and neither is the economic chaos we've been seeing. 
https://t.co/kqa1LzJHKf

Congress never should have left town without a COVID deal. Here’s a crazy thought – while we’re in DC voting to save the post office, let’s also get a deal so people have their unemployment benefits.

The death rate from Coronavirus is continuing to rise in our community – and every single one is a tragedy. Please stay safe folks.

This year’s homelessness count in Stanislaus County showed record highs. And this was taken before a single business in our community shut their doors due to Coronavirus. We need a stimulus deal so families can pay their rent and these numbers don’t get even worse.

During the pandemic my office has been able to help literally hundreds of people cut through red tape with EDD and the IRS – if you need help with unemployment, tracking down your stimulus check, or any other federal agency, call us today: 209-579-5458

This is a powerful story from inside our ICUs – and a reminder that anyone can get this virus. Please be safe!

A lot of people are rightly concerned about their kids’ mental health right now. We have to make sure they get the help and support they need. 
https://t.co/2C4f9NZcRk

Students of all ages have had their routines uprooted – they’re stuck at home, they aren’t seeing their friends, and they can’t just be kids. Today I pushed the Governor to make sure we have enough mental health professionals available for our kids during remote learning. https://t.co/8ZO25NVo0i

The Paycheck Protection Program has saved more than 70,000 jobs in our district. The program runs out of $ this weekend if there’s no COVID deal. Both parties need to put political games aside and hammer out this deal – there’s zero excuse for this delay. https://t.co/DjzxgciuQX
It’s time to find common ground and get this COVID deal hammered out. Another stimulus check, extended unemployment benefits, and money for our schools to safely reopen are top priorities.

Folks – yesterday we passed a grim milestone. More than 100 of our friends and neighbors in Stanislaus County have died from Coronavirus, and nearly 150 have passed in San Joaquin. My heart goes out to all our neighbors who have lost a loved one.

Folks – cases, hospitalizations, and sadly – deaths – are all still rising in Stanislaus and San Joaquin Counties for people of all ages. And less than 4% of adult ICU beds are available in Stanislaus. PLEASE BE SAFE.
